summary: endothelial dysfunction culminates with loss of endothelial-dependent vessel wall relaxation, increasing leukocyte-endothelial vessel wall adhesion, oxidized low-density lipoprotein (LDL) uptake, platelet aggregation, pro-inflammatory cytokine expression, and extracellular matrix (ECM) degradation. the use of anti-EMMPRIN specific antibodies downsized atheroma plaques, inhibiting the expression of MMPs [13] and monocyte recruitment to the vascular wall [14]. the same also applied in response to acute myocardial infarction, by preserving left ventricular function [5], and disrupting the complex CyPA/EMMPRIN [8]. of MMP-9, MMP-13, and EMMPRIN are expressed in human endarterectomy samples. hematoxylin/eosin and masson Trichrome stain in cross sections of human carotid endarterectomies. extensive expression of EMMPRIN, MMP-9 and MMP-13 was detected in smooth muscle cells and foam cells. hematoxylin/eosin stained carotid sections, and oilRedO staining on full size carotid sections were significantly increased in NOS3/apoE knockout (KO) mice. apoE NOS3/apoE knockout (KO) mice showed extensive atherosclerosis. carotid sections from apoE (upper), and NOS3/apoE null mice (lower) fed with Western-type diet for 12 weeks (N = 10 mice/group; apoE: 1671 200 vs. NOS3/apoE: 2834 286; * P: 0.002) lipid deposition on carotid aortas from same mice as in (A) mice fed with a Western diet for 12 weeks were intravenously injected with 0.1 mg/Kg/day NAP9 or saline. we analyzed the levels of MMP-9, indicative of EMMPRIN activation in carotid arteries. confocal microscopy detection of EMMPRIN (FITC, green) and NAP9 (Rhodamine, red), in carotid sections of NOS3/apoE null mice injected with 0.1 mg/kg/day NAP9 or saline (Control) we intravenously injected 0.1 mg/kg/day NAP9 or Control NP in apoE and NOS3/apoE KO mice fed with a Western diet for 12 weeks. a linear regression analysis found a positive correlation between NAP9 uptake and ex vivo measurement of EMMPRIN in carotid sections from the same mice. the efficacy of this non-invasive method for plaque detection was also assessed in the aortic arch of NOS3/apoE KO mice intravenously injected with 0.1 mg/kg/day NAP9 or control NP. non-invasive visualization of NAP9 by MRI in aortic arch of atherosclerotic NOS3/apoE KO mice. red dotted lines mark aortic arch and proximal carotid arteries. levels of MMP-9, MMP-13, and EMMPRIN were determined by immunohistochemistry in human crossed sections of carotid endarterectomy specimens. extensive expression of EMMPRIN, MMP-9 and MMP-13 was detected in smooth muscle cells and foam cells. EMMPRIN was also expressed in endothelial cells of vascularized plaques. lack of NOS3 Increases Atherosclerotic Lesions and Inflammatory Macrophages in apoE null Mice ApoE and NOS3/apoE double null mice developed atherosclerotic lesions. rotid lesion size (apoE: 1671 200 vs. NOS3/apoE: 2834 286; P: 0.002), and number (apoE: 3.25 1.25 vs. NOS3/apoE: 7.5 1.29; P: 0.003) were significantly increased in NOS3/apoE knockout (KO) mice (Figure 2A,B), suggesting measurement of NO might correlate with the extension of carotid atherosclerosis. mice as in (A) (N = 10 mice/group, apoE: 3.25 1.25 vs. NOS3/apoE: 7.5 1.29; * P: 0.003) co-localization of CD68 and EMMPRIN (N = 10 mice/group, apoE: 606 91.113 vs. NOS3/apoE: 1308.9 351.364) ques We previously found that NAP9 nanoparticles specifically target EMMPRIN in acute murine and porcine myocardial infarction. mice fed with a Western diet for 12 weeks were intravenously injected with 0.1 mg/Kg/day NAP9 or saline. we analyzed the levels of MMP-9, indicative of EMMPRIN activation in carotid arteries. we intravenously injected 0.1 mg/kg/day NAP9 or Control NP in apoE and NOS3/apoE KO mice fed with a Western diet for 12 weeks. a linear regression analysis detected a positive correlation between NAP9 uptake with ex vivo measurement of EMMPRIN in carotid sections from the same mice. ortic arch of NOS3/apoE KO mice intravenously injected with 0.1 mg/kg/day NAP9 or control NP. magnetic resonance image of enlarged carotid sections from atherosclerotic apoE and NOS3/apoE null mice injected with 0.1 mg/kg/day NAP9. non-invasive visualization of NAP9 by MRI in the aortic arch of atherosclerotic NOS3/apoE KO mice injected with 0.1 mg/kg/day control. red dotted lines mark aortic arch and proximal carotid arteries. black and gray surfaces represent gadolinium enhancement areas. null mice found that NAP9 nanoparticles may represent a new tool for non-invasive in vivo targeting of atherosclerosis. we also found that EMMPRIN is present in smooth muscle cells and endothelial cells from intraplaque vascularization. this is the case of Cyclophilin Cyp60, which drives EMMPRIN to the plasma membrane. a small molecule called Acriflavine inhibits the hypoxic response, proliferation, and tumor progression in glioblastoma cells [23] or the cardioprotective effect of NO in acute myocardial infarction in which the complex Caveolin-3/low-glycosylated EMMPRIN is stabilized by NO, thus preventing EMMPRIN glycosylation [20]. in the absence of NOS3, the levels of EMMPRIN positive intraplaque macrophage the use of antibody-mediated targeting of proteins has been evaluated. a new mechanism by which endothelial NO prevents carotid atherosclerosis, through inhibition of EMMPRIN-mediated MMP formation in macrophages, smooth muscle cells, and endothelial cells. limits may include the use of male younger mammary arteries as controls in the human analysis of carotid endarterectomies. further studies in porcine models of carotid atherosclerosis will be crucial for future testing in humans. apoE knockout animals were acquired from The Jackson Laboratory. four-week-old male mice were fed with Western diet for 12 weeks. 16-week-old mice were used for experimentation. blood samples were taken fom mice fed with Western diet. nanoparticles were synthesized by the lipid film hydration procedure. rotary evaporation of Rhodamine-PE, Gd-DTPA-bis and 1,2-distearoyl-sn-glycero-3-phosphoethanolamine-N-[methoxy (polyethylene glycol)-2000] were used to generate a lipid film in a molar ratio o 10:50:39:1. Statistical significance was determined by Student’s t test (two side unpaired) Differences were considered statistically significant at P 0.05. four-week-old male mice were fed with Western diet for 12 weeks. 16-week-old mice were used for experimentation. total cholestrol, triglicerides, and glucose levels were measured. paramagnetic nanoparticles were synthesized by the lipid film hydration procedure. rotary evaporation of Rhodamine-PE, Gd-DTPA-bis, 1,2-distearoyl-sn-glycero-3-phosphoethanolamine-N-[methoxy (polyethylene glycol)-2000) and DSPE-PEG2000-maleimide were used to generate a lipid film in a molar ratio o NER ( % ) = [ SNRca SNRt ] Post injection [ SNRca SNRt ] Pre injection 4.10 Statistical Analysis Unless otherwise specified, data were presented as means SD.
